text: The National Football League playoffs for the 2002 season started on January 4, 2003. The playoffs ended with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers beating the Oakland Raiders in Super Bowl XXXVII, 48–21, on January 26, at Qualcomm Stadium in San Diego, California. ==Participants== ==Bracket== ==Schedule== Away team Score Home Team Date Kickoff (ET / UTC–5) TV Wild Card playoffs Indianapolis Colts 0–41 New York Jets January 4, 2003 4:30 p.m. ABC Atlanta Falcons 27–7 Green Bay Packers January 4, 2003 8:00 p.m. ABC Cleveland Browns 33–36 Pittsburgh Steelers January 5, 2003 1:00 p.m. CBS New York Giants 38–39 San Francisco 49ers January 5, 2003 4:30 p.m. Fox Divisional playoffs Pittsburgh Steelers 31–34 Tennessee Titans January 11, 2003 4:30 p.m. CBS Atlanta Falcons 6–20 Philadelphia Eagles January 11, 2003 8:00 p.m. Fox San Francisco 49ers 6–31 Tampa Bay Buccaneers January 12, 2003 1:00 p.m. Fox New York Jets 10–30 Oakland Raiders January 12, 2003 4:30 p.m. CBS Conference Championships Tampa Bay Buccaneers 27–10 Philadelphia Eagles January 19, 2003 3:00 p.m. Fox Tennessee Titans 24–41 Oakland Raiders January 19, 2003 6:30 p.m. CBS Super Bowl XXXVII Qualcomm Stadium, San Diego, California Oakland Raiders 21–48 Tampa Bay Buccaneers January 26, 2003 6:30 p.m. ABC ==Notes and references== *NFL.com scores for the 2002 playoffs (Last accessed January 9, 2006) * Category:National Football League playoffs NFL playoffs
title: 2002–03 NFL playoffs
